items.name: Redchurch Bethnal Pale Ale
items.desc:
As refreshing and interesting as a warm summers day spent on Bethnal Green! Or perhaps getting boozy on the beach! Bethnal Green, London was home to the original and much-loved Redchurch taproom. We have a great reputation in the area, and it is somewhere we hold close to our hearts.
This modern American style pale ale boasts big tropical fruit aromas produced by a big blend of American hops. A citrus zing on the front of the palate followed by tasty passion fruit notes. Medium body with a refreshing bitterness.

items.name: Redchurch Great Eastern IPA
items.desc:
Just like the East London street after which it’s named, this beer packs in A LOT! A beer for the IPA connoisseur known for its big punchy flavours. At 7.4% this is a beer that you are going to want to take your time with, appreciate and enjoy every last drop. Pairs awesome with your favourite curry or cheese board. Yes PLEASE!
Packed full of American hops that give a strong orange and citrus fruit flavour coupled with a balanced bitterness. Hints of grapefruit complete the taste sensation.

items.name: Redchurch Herbal Lemody
items.desc:
Hazy, dry and packed full of clean bursts of honeydew melon and soft lemon and lime, with a hint of herbal clove and black pepper spice. Refreshing and warming in combination, perfect for cool nights in or hot days out.

items.name: Redchurch Hoxton Stout
items.desc:
Our core range wouldn’t be complete without a beautiful stout. Born out of London the stout has been a staple beer in the drinking culture of this fantastic city and our Hoxton Stout doesn’t hold back when leaving its footprint on the great stouts that came before it.
With aromas of toasted bread, coffee and chocolate followed by a clear taste of punchy American hops gives you a fresh, almost fruity flavour with a pleasant kick of bitterness to finish. Indulge in the darkness! And at only 5% there Is no need to be afraid of the dark.

items.name: Redchurch Lager
items.desc:
Redchurch Lager was first brewed in an apartment on Redchurch Street, London in 2011 and remains our flagship beer, guaranteed to please the palate of every lager enthusiast. This beer is brewed with a clear goal in mind; to sway you from those ‘safe’ lagers we all gravitate towards down the local.
So why Redchurch Lager? We care for the process, meaning we don’t rush a thing. Redchurch Lager is less carbonated, packs more flavour and is as fresh as a crisp British morning. We believe so much in our lager that we don’t inflate our prices meaning our beers are competitive to those you find in the supermarket. Give it a go!
Characteristic hints of British malt with a grassy aroma. German and American hops complement each other and work with the sweetness of the malt base to provide a refreshing, clean and exceptionally well-balanced beer.

items.name: Redchurch Paradise IPA
items.desc:
Brewed with you in mind, this session IPA is there for those moments you want an all-day drinking beer or perhaps a beer to enjoy at lunch time before heading back to the office. The name stems from Paradise Row in Bethnal Green which boasts a rich 340-year history and today is a social hub for those calling East London home. A cosmopolitan oasis that creates a little piece of East London Paradise….and that’s why we love it!
The moderate alcohol content is supported by a strong malt base with added oats for a fuller body. The bouquet is explosive with zesty fresh lime, tropical fruits and citrus making this beer fresh, easy-drinking and complex in equal measure.

items.name: Redchurch Shoreditch Blonde
items.desc:
It’s time to bring some Belgian inspired beer to the hipster hub of East London and beyond. This is unlike no other beer that you would have tasted by a British brewery. An individual within its class…a standout. So very Shoreditch. A fantastic beer for those looking to expand their beer palate. If you are partial to white wine this could be the beer for you. Pairs great with seafood dishes, cheese boards and a nice bit of crusty bread…we like grabbing a few of these for a day spent on the picnic blanket!
Saison yeast is the star of the show and pairs with European hops to give a fruit and banana aroma. Bitter but fruity, Extra pale malt and wheat malt give a sweetness and full body.

items.name: Redchurch Stort Valley Kölsch
items.desc:
This German Kölsch style ale is crisp and refreshing with a well-rounded bitterness and solid pilsner malt base.
Subtle sweetness is accompanied by aromas of apple, pear and tropical fruits from the use of traditional German hops.
